qas.question: What are they only two additions to Paris' administrative limits since 1860?

answers.text: Bois de Boulogne, Bois de Vincennes

qas.question: When was the Siene department created?
WHen was District de la region parisienne reorganised?
What was the Paris region renamed to?
When was Paris reunited with its suburbs?

context: Aside from the 20th century addition of the <a0_0>Bois de Boulogne, Bois de Vincennes<a0_0/> and Paris heliport, Paris' administrative limits have remained unchanged since 1860. The Seine département had been governing Paris and its suburbs since its creation in <a1_0>1790<a1_0/>, but the rising suburban population had made it difficult to govern as a unique entity. This problem was 'resolved' when its parent "District de la région parisienne" (Paris region) was reorganised into several new departments from <a2_0>1968<a2_0/>: Paris became a department in itself, and the administration of its suburbs was divided between the three departments surrounding it. The Paris region was renamed <a3_0>"Île-de-France"<a3_0/> in 1977, but the "Paris region" name is still commonly used today. Paris was reunited with its suburbs on <a4_0>January 1, 2016<a4_0/> when the Métropole du Grand Paris came into existence.
